channel.title: My first autominer
channel.description: Hi all, I'm kinda new to this and after some studying I decided to try to make a simple autominer. It's working and thats at least something but I want to improve a few things. What happens now is that the script searches a rock with a specific color, clicks on it, then waits x seconds, right clicks on ore in inventory, drops it, and goes through it again. But what I want is: Mine a rock, and when ore [u]appears[/u] in inventory drop the ore and move on to the next (or same if it has respawned) rock, so without the fixed wait. Can anyone help me please?

item.title: My first autominer
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

koekenbakker:

Ok thanks, that already was of some help to me. But how do you know when the rock is mined so you need to move on to the next one?

Oh, most people don’t know. They just put a wait time on to move to the next rock depending on your mining level.
e.g:
If you’re mining level 1 with a bronze pickaxe and wanting to mine Tin or Copper, you would put a wait time of 7.5 seconds (7500). If with an iron pickaxe on mining level 1 you would probably put a wait time of 5 seconds (5000).

Read full topic

item.title: My first autominer
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

You could do something like this:

MineRock;
repeat
Wait(150);
until FindDTM(DTM_OF_ORE_HERE, x, y);
Mouse(x, y, 3, 3, False);
ChooseOption(Drop);

I don’t think any of this works but look some functions up in the SRL manual.

Read full topic

item.title: My first autominer
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

koekenbakker:

Hi all, I’m kinda new to this and after some studying I decided to try to make a simple autominer. It’s working and thats at least something but I want to improve a few things. What happens now is that the script searches a rock with a specific color, clicks on it, then waits x seconds, right clicks on ore in inventory, drops it, and goes through it again. But what I want is: Mine a rock, and when ore appears in inventory drop the ore and move on to the next (or same if it has respawned) rock, so without the fixed wait. Can anyone help me please?

Ummm, i am not quite sure what you mean but here is a shot.

Procedure MineAndDrop;
begin
[b]if/b then
MoveMouseSmooth(x,y);
Wait(1000)
ClickMouse(x,y,True);
Wait(1000)
[b]if/b then
Wait(2500)
if(FindBitmap(RockInInventoryColour,x,y)) then
MoveMouseSmooth(x,y);
Wait(600)
ClickMouse(x,y,True);
Wait(1000)
[b]if/b then
MoveMouseSmooth(x,y);
Wait(1000)
ClickMouse(x,y,True);
end;

Pretty Basic… But that could do…
WARNING: [b]Do not use the script above as it has no anti bans or anti randoms and could get you banned easily, instead use SRL’s Commands for some of the function.

Read full topic
